quest.name: Shadowed Pasts
journal: Something has this Radiant scout unnerved.

The Radiant scout explains to you that he recently happened upon a voidsent while out on patrol. The beast was strangely docile, however, and against his better judgment, he chose to capture rather than slay it. Hearing of your recent foray into the void, he hopes your expertise can prove useful in discerning what the voidsent may be plotting. To that end, he asks you to accompany him to the Hall of the Radiant Host.

Having died shortly after your arrival at the court of Troia, the sullen-eyed voidsent fled to the Source seeking sanctuary from the void's vicious cycle of undeath. However, it was not fully recovered before making the journey, causing it to split into several lesser voidsent. It asks that you search Radz-at-Han for its missing kin. In exchange, they will share with you knowledge of the void.

You travel about the city and find four wayward hecteyes, each of which recounts a grim tale of the Thirteenth and the denizens of the void. The voidsent will no doubt be glad to be reunited, and the Radiant scout relieved to know the streets are safe.

The sullen-eyed voidsent thanks you for gathering its kindred voidsent, and makes ready to reunite with them...but something is amiss. It would seem there are yet more pieces of itself that have yet to be found. Should the hecteyes sense more wayward voidsent, it hopes you will answer its call for help once more.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Forename, you couldn't have appeared at a better time!

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: You see, while out patrolling the city, I chanced to sight a voidsent.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: I immediately chased it down with the intent of eliminating it, but something about it struck me as odd. For one, it made no move to defend itself, but simply sat there, er...jiggling. Which is why, against my better judgment, I decided to capture it instead.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Having traveled to the void, I daresay you have considerable knowledge of its denizens. If you have a moment, might I trouble you for your opinion on the creature's unusual behavior?

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: I'm truly grateful! Now, if you would follow me, the creature is being held in the Hall of the Radiant Host.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The voidsent glowers in your direction, but says nothing.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Here it is.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Surprisingly docile, even when I captured it. And there have been no reports of attacks prior to that.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Even so, it's the nature of voidsent to prey on people for their aether. Perhaps it bides its time, waiting to carry out some manner of scheme...

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: You! I remember you. Yes, you were at Troia. Please, you must help me!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What do you need help with?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You were at the castle?

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Oho, you do understand me!

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Indeed I was, but I've since fled here.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: I understand the mortal tongue well enough, but I don't have a mouth to produce the sounds. It's been a struggle to convey my thoughts.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: But not anymore! You can help me, yes you can!

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: You can converse with the voidsent? Amazing! Could you ask it why it came here?

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: When you and yours stormed the castle, I was caught up in the fighting and died.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: In time I returned, but I tire of fighting. So I fled, using the gate to your world.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Having just been reborn, however, my essence hadn't fully bound together yet. And so, when I emerged from the gate, it was as several sundered selves.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Frightened and confused, they scattered. Following their trail led me here, my diminutive size allowing me to remain largely unseen.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: But by the same token, I can do little more than sneak about. Each of us was weak and powerless. That's why we consumed one another in the first place. Together we were strong. I want you to help me find all of me, so that I can be whole again.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You wish to strike a bargain, then?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: What did you intend to do in this world?

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Yes, I would. To be whole again and live in this world, I would strike a thousand bargains!

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Why, live here, of course. I've always wanted to.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: I─we─still remember the past, you see. Still remember when we were mortals.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: We long to have that life again. But we need your help, starting by reuniting us. We won't try to devour anyone even when we're whole, I swear!

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: You wish to learn more about the void, yes? There is much we can teach you about those who rule its domains. About their past.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Find the others, and they'll tell you all they know. No eating, no tricks. Do we have a bargain?

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: So it crossed over to our world to escape conflict, and now searches for...the rest of itself?

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: I understand voidsent are quite reliable when it comes to fulfilling a pact. And I daresay having one as an ally would benefit our research into their world...

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Very well. If you would be so kind as to search for its kin, I will consult my superiors on how best to deal with them.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: By that, I take it we have a bargain. Good, good.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: I sense four others close by. When you find them, you need only point them in this direction. Once they sense my presence, I can guide them the rest of the way.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: My thanks again for your help. If you could see the other voidsent back here, I will tend to the rest.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Like me, the others have an interest in the lives of mortals. They are bound to be here, in this city.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have found the last of the voidsent. Time to head back to the Hall of the Radiant Host.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: What's that? I asked you to search for me...in exchange for knowledge about powerful voidsent?

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: I was still wanting to see this and that, but I suppose a deal is a deal...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: Those men over there. Soldiers, are they not? We used to have soldiers in our world, too. There were lots of them during the Contramemoria.

dialogue.name: WARRIOR04660A
dialogue.text: Ah, back from Weaver's Warding, are you? I hear you fought well against the voidsent that slipped through.

dialogue.name: WARRIOR04660B
dialogue.text: Come now, I merely did my duty. Haven't we all sworn to protect our nation, no matter the cost?

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: “Protect our nation.” How familiar, those words. Where was it that I heard them...?

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. It was the early days of the Contramemoria. The enemy had conjured a terrible eidolon that laid siege to a fortress.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: The garrison was made up of ordinary soldiers. Men and women with no remarkable abilities. But led by their valiant commander, they fought bravely and desperately.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: They had to last until the memoriate arrived, the commander told them. Needed to hold out no matter the cost.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: A memoriate did eventually arrive. But not soon enough for the soldiers.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Having struck down the eidolon, the memoriate and his servant searched the castle for survivors. They found only the dead.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)But just when they had given up all hope, a faint groaning reached their ears. They rushed over to the sound, and cleared away debris...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)...To find a lone survivor: the garrison commander.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Instead of joy, however, the sight of the man filled them with anger.

dialogue.name: STEWARD04660
dialogue.text: Your soldiers are slaughtered to a man, yet there's barely a scratch on you! What's the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: The eidolon was savage, but mindless. It was a simple thing to hide myself beneath fallen debris.

dialogue.name: MEMORIAMASTER04660
dialogue.text: Hide!? As commander, you had a duty to your men! You were supposed to put their lives before your own!

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Spare me! My duty was to ensure the fortress stood─and it did!

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Besides, my death would've achieved nothing, honor be damned! No, I'm sworn to protect our nation, and to do that I must live! It isn't my fate to fall here!

dialogue.name: MEMORIAMASTER04660
dialogue.text: It isn't your fate, you say?

dialogue.name: STEWARD04660
dialogue.text: Is... Is he...?

dialogue.name: MEMORIAMASTER04660
dialogue.text: Merely unconscious. Come, let us bury the soldiers...and their commander with them.

dialogue.name: MEMORIAMASTER04660
dialogue.text: Fate shall decide what becomes of him. Whether he lives or dies.

dialogue.name: STEWARD04660
dialogue.text: Very well, my lord.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Funeral rites were later held for the fallen. But solemn tears quickly gave way to horrified screams as a body emerged from the earth─the commander.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)“I can't die. I must live,” the man is said to have declared.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)The people thought him a demon. A disheveled horror, muttering curses as he wandered off to regions unknown.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Scarmiglione, they called him. A name befitting his newfound grisly visage. A name befitting a monster.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: We thought we buried him deep. But a mortal's desire to live is not to be underestimated.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: You're a mortal, so I expect you understand that desire.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660A
dialogue.text: Well, that concludes my tale. I had best rejoin my selves. If you'll excuse me...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: So this is where mortals consume aether.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: Dreading loneliness more than hunger... How very like me. If you don't mind, though, I'd like to observe the mortals a while longer.

dialogue.name: ARKASODARA04660A
dialogue.text: The food here is simply sublime! Why, I feel stronger with every bite, as if the Mrga Themselves were granting me Their blessing!

dialogue.name: ARKASODARA04660B
dialogue.text: The food is tasty, that's true enough. But no food is so sublime as to be a substitute for proper training, my friend.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: Stronger with every bite, every feed...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: For my part of the bargain, I will tell you about how we voidsent become strong. Simply put, it depends on the quality and quantity of aether we harbor.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: When the world was consumed by Darkness, the heroes known as memoriates arose as powerful voidsent.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: In contrast, the vast majority of mortals, powerless and unremarkable as they were, became ordinary voidsent. Like me.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: There were exceptions, of course. But one in particular, I'll never forget.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Scarmiglione... Never had I seen a voidsent so craven. Even when pushed to the brink of starvation, he would prey only on those weaker than himself.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)He subsisted on scant leavings, and lived in constant fear and hunger.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)In the face of danger, of voidsent stronger than himself, fleeing was the only option.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)But a day came when he found his way barred.

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)How pitiful...

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: S-Such overwhelming aether... Who is this!?

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)You fled instead of facing your foe. Why?

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Why? I'm too weak, why else? I would have been devoured.

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)So had you enough strength, you would have stood your ground? ...Very well, then.

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Wh-What's happening!?

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Yesss. I feel it... The power, ssswelling within me!

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)Lo, your foe returns.

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Hissssss... What have you done to me?

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)I granted you but a sliver of aether. 'Twas with the power you already possessed that you defeated your foe.

dialogue.name: EARTHMONOLITH
dialogue.text: I possessed such power...?

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)Fear had clouded your eyes. Blinded you to the strength you had attained feeding on the weak.

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)If you would free yourself from fear, then join me. You shall have a greater cause to live for and know true power.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Curious how, in a world without death, the fear of it could be the key to great strength.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)The knight recognized this─recognized the voidsent's potential. And thus did he take him into his service.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: Determined as he is to live, it wouldn't surprise me if he were still somewhere out there.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: He'd be even more powerful now, I expect, from all the devouring he would have done since. Unlike your world, eating actually makes you stronger in ours.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660B
dialogue.text: Well, I must be going now. The others are waiting.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: My other self grows lonely, you say?

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: My apologies. It was my intent to seek out the others, but I was distracted by the bickering pair of mortals yonder. My goodness, but there's been some colorful language!

dialogue.name: MAN04660
dialogue.text: To hells with your father! You shouldn't need his permission just to leave the godsdamned house!

dialogue.name: WOMAN04660
dialogue.text: Please, mind your language! What would Father say if he were to hear you?

dialogue.name: MAN04660
dialogue.text: Ugh, it's always “Father this, Father that” with you! I'm sick of it! You're your own woman now─bloody act like one for a change!

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: Colorful language, yes? Not from the girl, though. Oh no, she appears to be quite well bred.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: I just hope she's happier than a girl I knew long, long ago...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)That girl was born into a family of thugs who suddenly found themselves nobility.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)She was raised as a noblewoman, and had servants tending to her every need. But in the end, she was merely a beautiful bird kept in a gilded cage.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Wanting her to be a proper lady, her parents presided over all aspects of her life. They decided everything for her, telling her what to say and do.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Chafing from the fetters of her restrictive life, she solicited her handmaiden's aid and stole outside the manor, where she enjoyed a moment of bliss unbeknownst to her parents. Or so she thought...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)It was not long before her father dragged her back to her room, barring the door and windows, denying her even the simple pleasure of an afternoon breeze.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Even a bird in a cage may chirp freely, but she wasn't even suffered to give voice to her desires.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)But she wouldn't be deterred. Having once tasted sweet freedom, she yearned for more. And one day, she succeeded in sneaking out of the manor a second time.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: You're late. I was beginning to think you wouldn't come.

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: If you're expecting your friends, I'm afraid they're not coming.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: F-Father!? How did you─? What do you mean...they're not coming?

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: I had known that some miscreants were cavorting in these parts, but to think that they'd dare try to consort with my daughter... Well, you needn't worry about them anymore. They're food for the fishes now.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: <gasp> How could you do this, Father!? Why must you torment me so!?

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: Know your place, girl! You are a means for our family to gain influence, and I won't have you sullying yourself with riffraff!

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: You will not leave your chambers save with my permission, nor will you disobey me again. If you do so, there will be severe consequences. Am I understood?

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: I said, am I understood!?

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: ...To hell.

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: What did you say?

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: I said, go to hell!

dialogue.name: DAD04660
dialogue.text: Aaarrrgggh!

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Oh, to think that it could be so exhilarating to speak my mind! To do as I please!

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: No more living in a cage. From this moment on, I am free! Free as the wind!

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)The young woman struck out on her own, and in her travels discovered her true calling─not in the halls of lords and ladies, but on the battlefield.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)She became a force of nature, famed for her striking beauty which belied a terrible savagery.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)And with this new life she also claimed a new name─Barbariccia.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: Indeed, she found her freedom, but did she also find happiness, I wonder...?

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: I suppose I'll never know. Nor does it matter, for the world that once was is no more.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660C
dialogue.text: Oh, but goodness me. I had better rejoin the others.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: Ah, what a refreshing breeze.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: I'm to return to the others? Bah, they should come here!

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: Would you look at this beautiful, boundless sky? Mortals take to the air from here, do they not? Would that I had wings to soar among the clouds myself...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: But we voidsent are not wont to roam, you see. The mightiest among us carve out domains, while the rest labor to stay in their good graces.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: Now, the master of a domain seldom ventures outside, for it is in one's territory that one is strongest.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: For some, however, such confinement proved trying. As was the case for a certain voidsent I knew.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)I speak of the free-spirited terror, Barbariccia. When she first established her domain, she whiled away the days waiting for her minions to bring her prey.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)The aether amassed from these offerings was devoted to the singular pleasure of caring for her silky, flowing locks. But the resources of her domain were not without their limits.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)It was only when none remained to oppose her that she realized: she was a prisoner in her own domain. And unless she broke free, she would inevitably wither away, alone.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Not knowing what to do, she had fallen into the depths of despair...when the hand of salvation came to pull her out.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: At this rate, my precious hair will frazzle and fray. Had I only the strength to leave my domain...

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)If strength is your desire, that is easily granted.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Who are you!?

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Ahhh! So much power, surging through me!

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)And what will you do with it? What is it you desire?

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: What I desire... What I desire is...

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)You would move your very domain? Impressive.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: That I can do such a thing... What have you done to me?

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)I granted you aether, nothing more. It was your will that made it possible.

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: My will...

dialogue.name: BLACKKNIGHT
dialogue.text: (-Knight in Black-)Even so, no matter where you should go, there is naught but Darkness. What could your destination possibly be?

dialogue.name: WINDMONOLITH
dialogue.text: Destination? I have no need of such. I wish but to be free, like the wind.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)In a world that has met its end, rare indeed is the soul who desires freedom so ardently that she could will her very domain to move.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: (-Wayward Hecteye-)Recognizing this quality, the knight would grant her more power─and a place of command in his mighty army.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: A story worthy of our bargain, I trust. I might've had more to tell had I not fallen off her domain.

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: It seems you mortals also have a fondness for flying. I'd certainly like to try riding one of these airships of yours...

dialogue.name: VOIDSENT04660D
dialogue.text: But perhaps another time. My other selves will be a blubbering mess if I don't hurry and rejoin them.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: The voidsent are all present and accounted for. So long as they remain here, we needn't worry about panic among the townsfolk.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for finding me.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: I hope the knowledge I had to share was worthy of our agreement.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: More than worthy, I'd say. They told me of Scarmiglione and Barbariccia.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: How did you come to know the archfiends?

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: My other selves lived quite disparate lives both as mortals and voidsent. Though I suppose it is rather fortuitous that they crossed paths with such powerful voidsent.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: But more importantly, what they could offer was worthy of our bargain. For that, I am glad.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: All that remains now is for us to rejoin and become whole again.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: ...Huh? Is...is this not all of me?

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: There can be no other explanation. There is still more of me lost out there somewhere.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: But I don't sense them. Where could they have gone?

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: You mean there's more of them wandering about!? By the Sisters...

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: <sigh> At the very least, if what you say is true, they pose no threat to the people.

dialogue.name: SCOUT04660
dialogue.text: Until the others can be found, we will keep these five under our care.

dialogue.name: HECTEYES
dialogue.text: Should I sense the others nearby, I hope we can count on you to find them too.
